name: Kyoto University of Advanced Sciences Scholarship
description: Kyoto University of Advanced Science (KUAS) offers several scholarships for international students, with the main ones being the Super KUAS-E Scholarship and the KUAS-E Scholarship. These are for students entering the Faculty of Engineering and Graduate School of Engineering programs. The university also has scholarships for currently enrolled students, as well as affiliations with external scholarships.

name: Global Korea Scholarship (GKS)
description: GKS, or Global Korea Scholarship for short, formerly known as KGSP (Korea Global Scholarship Program), is a full scholarship program managed by NIIED (National Institute for International Education), an executive agency under the South Korean Ministry of Education. This scholarship is given by the South Korean government to international students who want to study in Korea for the level of D2 (Associate Degree), S1, S2, and S3.

name: National Tsing Hua University - International Student Scholarship (Spring Intake)
description: Scholarship for international students enrolling in various degree programs at NTHU for the Spring Intake. (Based on document: S-1, S-2, S-3)

name: Danish Government Scholarship - Aarhus University (Winter Intake)
description: The "Danish Government Scholarship" at Aarhus University is actually a Danish State Scholarship for talented non-EU/EEA/Swiss students to pursue a Master's degree. Eligibility is limited to students who meet the general admission requirements, and the scholarship is automatically awarded based on your application; no separate one is needed. The scholarship typically provides either a full or partial tuition fee waiver, along with a monthly living allowance

name: University of San Francisco - Merit Scholarship
description: The University of San Francisco (USF) offers merit scholarships to eligible first-year and transfer students based on their academic achievement. All applicants are automatically considered for these awards; there is no separate application required.

name: University of Auckland Scholarship
description: Scholarship offered by the University of Auckland for international students at the undergraduate and master's level.

name: Autumn Japan Culture Camp - Asean Youth Friendship Network (AFYN)
description: This autumn, AYFN presents an opportunity for young individuals to engage in a short-term Japanese cultural immersion program. The camp invites participants from around the globe to experience Japan first-hand through exciting and meaningful activities. Held in collaboration with a local partner, this program is crafted to help international participants broaden their understanding of Japanese culture and society. The agenda includes daily activities and cultural excursions to offer a full immersion experience. English will be used as the primary language, so no prior knowledge of Japanese is necessary. Our mission is to cultivate global-minded youth who are open to diverse cultures and passionate about learning new languages. Participants will return home not only with improved cultural awareness and language basics, but also with lifelong memories and friendships.

name: Romanian Government Scholarship
description: The Romanian Government Scholarship is a fully funded program for international students from non-EU countries who wish to pursue Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degrees in Romania. The scholarship is managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) and covers tuition, accommodation, and a monthly stipend

name: Chevening Oxford Centre for Islamic Studies Fellowship (OCIS)
description: The Chevening Oxford Centre for Islamic Studies (OCIS) and OCIS Abdullah Gül Fellowships are a collaboration between the UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office and the OCIS. They’re for mid-career professionals and academics who are dedicated to promoting academic activities that encourage a more informed understanding of the culture and civilisation of Islam and contemporary Muslim societies. Fellows will learn how to engage with complex global challenges through the lens of Islamic thought, diplomacy, and contemporary policy, while deepening their understanding of international relations, interfaith dialogue, and leadership in diverse cultural contexts.

name: British Council Women in STEM Scholarships
description: The British Council offers Women in STEM scholarships in partnership with UK universities to support women from various countries pursuing master's degrees in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics.

name: KAIST Scholarship (Spring Intake)
description: The KAIST scholarship is a fully funded scholarship for international students seeking to pursue undergraduate or graduate studies for the spring intake in South Korea. The scholarship application is integrated into the general admissions process, and no separate application is needed

name: Fulbright Scholarships for Indonesia
description: Fulbright scholarships are available to Indonesian citizens to undertake graduate degree study or advanced research at a US university in a variety of fields. The MA and PhD scholarships support two and three years of graduate study respectively at a US university. The Visiting Scholar Program allows an Indonesian holding a doctoral degree to carry out research for three to six months at an American university. Selection preference is given to candidates with limited recent US experience. Qualified individuals from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Applications from qualified candidates outside major Javan cities are particularly welcome.

name: The Chinese University Of Hong Kong, Shenzhen Scholarship
description: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen (CUHK-Shenzhen) offers a variety of scholarships for undergraduate and postgraduate students based on academic merit, performance, and financial need. These scholarships are available to international students, mainland Chinese students, and students from Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan. (Based on document: S-1)
university: The Chinese University Of Hong Kong, Shenzhen

name: Beahrs Environmental Leadership Program (UC Berkeley)
description: The Beahrs ELP at UC Berkeley provides mid-career environmental professionals with interdisciplinary training in environmental management and sustainable development. Partial scholarships are available for participants from developing regions.
fields: Environmental Management, Sustainability, Climate Change Policy

name: Korea University Global Leader Scholarship
description: The Korea University (KU) Global Leader Scholarship is a partial scholarship for outstanding international students at the undergraduate and graduate levels, awarded based on academic merit when applying to Korea University. The scholarship includes a tuition fee waiver, with coverage levels varying depending on merit, and is renewable if students are able to maintain a high GPA in subsequent semesters.

name: The Rhodes Scholarships for Global - The University of Oxford
description: The Rhodes Global Scholarships offer fully-funded postgraduate study at the University of Oxford for students from countries not served by an existing Rhodes constituency. The selection criteria emphasize academic excellence, character, leadership, and a commitment to service

name: University of Southern California - Merit, Trustee, Presidential Scholarships
description: Administered through the Office of Admission and ranging in value from a few thousand dollars up to full tuition, USC Merit Scholarships are awarded based on academic excellence, leadership, service and talent. Merit scholarships at USC are highly competitive, but last year, over 1,000 admitted student earned scholarships of $10,000 per year or more. USC also awards a scholarship valued at $20,000 per year for students who are admitted to USC, named National Merit Finalists by the National Merit Corporation, and list USC as their first-choice institution with NMSC. Merit scholarships are reserved for students with special qualifications, such as academic, athletic or artistic talent. Awards are also available for students who are interested in particular fields of study, are actively involved in different cultural communities or live in certain areas of the country. Merit scholarships and need-based financial aid have separate application processes.

name: NUS Research Scholarship
description: The University offers Research Scholarships to outstanding PhD and Master's candidates to pursue a full-time graduate research degree at NUS. A limited number of scholarships is available each academic year. They are therefore awarded on a very competitive basis and only to the very best candidates. Applicants must be university graduates with at least Second Class Honours (Upper Division)/Honours (Distinction) or equivalent and at the time of the award of the Research Scholarship must have been offered admission to a full-time graduate research programme at this University. In addition, candidates must be eligible for the MOE subsidy on tuition fees in order to be eligible for the Scholarship. The Research Scholarship is initially awarded for one year. It may be renewed each semester on the basis of the scholar's performance in the previous semesters and the recommendation of the Faculty. The end-date of award is the end of the fourth year of candidature for PhD candidates and end of second year for Master's candidates.

name: LPDP Beasiswa Bundling France Program Doktor
description: The LPDP - France Scholarship Doctoral Program Year 2025 is a partnership scholarship program between the LPDP and the French Government that provides opportunities for applicants to study doctoral programs in priority areas of Indonesian development in accordance with the knowledge expertise possessed by Universities in France, in order to produce competent future Indonesian leaders in these fields.

name: Wellcome International Master's and PhD Scholarships
description: The Wellcome Scholarships fund master's and PhD students in low- and middle-income countries who aim to improve health through research. The program supports fields like biomedicine, epidemiology, and public health.
fields: Biomedical Sciences, Global Health, Epidemiology, Public Health
tags: Health, Fully Funded, Research, Developing Countries

name: Global Korea Scholarship for Graduate Degrees (GKS-G) Embassy Track 2025
description: The Global Korea Scholarship for Graduate Degrees (GKS-G) is a full scholarship for international students offered by the Korean government to pursue master's or doctoral degrees in Korea. The program includes a year of Korean language training followed by a 2-year master's degree or a 3-year doctoral degree.

name: Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) Scholarship
description: The IsDB Scholarship provides financial support to academically outstanding Muslim students from member countries and Muslim communities worldwide to pursue undergraduate, master's, PhD, and postdoctoral studies in fields aligned with sustainable development goals.
fields: STEM, Health, Agriculture, Environment, Development Studies

name: Chevening Scholarship
description: Chevening is the UK Government’s prestigious international scholarships programme. Funded by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office, and partner organisations, we offer exceptional future leaders the opportunity to further their education in the UK. At a time of unprecedented global challenges, the Chevening network offers a real cause for hope. Our community of leaders and decision-makers is already making a measurable impact in areas like climate action, economic prosperity, and conflict recovery.

name: The World in Serbia Scholarship
description: The Republic of Serbia actively implements programs that enable foreign students, as well as Serbians living in the region, to study free of charge at public universities. As part of the ”World in Serbia” project, foreign students are allowed to study free of charge at universities in the Republic of Serbia that were founded by the state, including all study programs and study levels. The „World in Serbia” project is an initiative of the Government of the Republic of Serbia of national importance and refers to the awarding of scholarships by the Government of the Republic of Serbia to candidates from countries in Africa, Asia, Central and South America, which are members and observer states of the Non-Aligned Movement. Currently, 536 scholarship holders from 127 countries are actively studying in Serbia as part of the "World in Serbia" project.

name: Microsoft Research PhD Fellowship
description: The Microsoft Research PhD Fellowship supports exceptional doctoral students pursuing research in computer science, electrical engineering, or mathematics. It provides tuition and a living stipend for two academic years.
fields: Computer Science, Data Science, AI, Cloud Computing, Mathematics

name: Facebook (Meta) PhD Fellowship
description: The Meta PhD Fellowship Program supports doctoral students conducting research in computer science and engineering fields relevant to Meta, including AI, AR/VR, data science, and computational social science.
fields: AI, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Data Science, Engineering

name: LPDP Scholarship
description: The Lembaga Pengelola Dana Pendidikan (LPDP) Scholarship is a scholarship program from the Indonesian government to continue studies to Masters (S2) or Doctoral (S3) levels at home and abroad. This program aims to prepare future leaders and professionals and encourage innovation in Indonesia.

name: Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) - University Admission Scholarship
description: HKUST's University Admission Scholarship is awarded to top-performing students based on holistic evaluation of their academic and non-academic achievements, without requiring a separate application for the university-level award. Scholarships can be one-off or renewable, and may cover all or part of the tuition fees, with the largest being up to full tuition plus a living allowance of HK$60,000 per year for undergraduate programs. Specific schools or programs may offer their own additional scholarships awards to promising students.

name: University of Canberra - UC Merit Scholarship
description: Awarded to commencing international students applying to study a course at UC, subject to meeting the UC and PG qualifying criteria. All applicants are assessed for a scholarship at the time of application to the course at UC. No further application is required. Scholarships are granted on a first-come-first-served basis until filled. Students are advised to accept the scholarship as soon as possible in order to avoid disappointment. Scholarships are limited and may be withdrawn if capacity is reached. The scholarship is valid only for the intake and course specified and will be confirmed once all conditions are met, your offer is accepted, and required payments are completed. The University reserves the right to withdraw or rescind the scholarship offer in exceptional circumstances.

name: ETH Zurich - Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP)
description: The ETH Zurich Excellence Scholarship & Opportunity Programme (ESOP) is a highly competitive, fully-funded scholarship for top-tier national and international students pursuing a Master's degree. The program provides financial support, mentorship, and networking opportunities to attract exceptional talent to ETH Zurich.

name: Manaaki New Zealand Scholarship
description: Manaaki New Zealand Scholarships help build prosperity, security, and sustainable growth in partner countries and foster a lifetime connection to Aotearoa New Zealand and the leaders of tomorrow. Recipients of a Manaaki New Zealand Scholarship build life-long connections to each other and to Aotearoa New Zealand while gaining a globally recognised education, an authentically New Zealand experience, and the tools to help their countries achieve the futures they deserve. The Manaaki New Zealand Scholarship Programme aims to enhance the mana of partner countries and Aotearoa New Zealand through manaakitanga - the act of hosting, supporting, and honouring manaaki scholars.

name: Australia Awards Scholarships
description: Australia Awards Scholarships are long-term awards administered by the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade. They aim to contribute to the development needs of Australia's partner countries in line with bilateral and regional agreements. They provide opportunities for people from developing countries, particularly those countries located in the Indo-Pacific region, to undertake full time undergraduate or postgraduate study at participating Australian universities and Technical and Further Education (TAFE) institutions. The study and research opportunities provided by Australia Awards Scholarships develop the skills and knowledge of individuals to drive change and contribute to development in their own countries.

name: University of Toronto - The Lester B. Pearson International Student Scholarships
description: The Pearson International Student Scholarships cover tuition, books, incidental fees and full residence support for four years. The scholarship is tenable only at the University of Toronto for first-entry, undergraduate programs. Each year approximately 37 students will be named Pearson Scholars.

name: Chinese Government Scholarship - CSC Scholarship
description: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious award for international students provided by the China Scholarship Council (CSC), an agency under China's Ministry of Education. The scholarship aims to promote educational, cultural, and academic exchanges between China and other countries. The scholarship is offered in different categories and can provide a full or partial waiver of fees for undergraduate, master's, and doctoral studies, as well as general and senior scholar programs.

name: DSU Scholarship, Politecnico di Milano
description: The DSU (Diritto allo Studio Universitario) Scholarship at Politecnico di Milano is a need-based financial aid program intended for low-income students, both Italian and international. The scholarship is not based on academic merit, but rather the economic condition of the applicant's family.

name: Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree in Environmental Sciences, Policy and Management (MESPOM)
description: MESPOM is an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master’s program that trains students to address complex environmental challenges through a multidisciplinary approach combining science, policy, and management.
university: University of Manchester, Central European University, Lund University, University of the Aegean
tags: Environment, Erasmus, Fully Funded, Joint Program

name: Delft University of Technology - The QuTech Scholarship
description: The Eric Bleumink Fellowship is a Fully Funded Scholarship for International students to undertake a Master’s Degree Program at the University of Groningen. The Applications are open to apply for the Eric Bleumink Fellowship 2026 in the Netherlands. The Scholarship applies to all Master’s Programs taught at the University of Groningen. The Eric Bleumink Fund Scholarship allows international students to pursue an MSc/MA/LL.M degree program on a Full Scholarship.

name: Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program
description: The JJ/WBGSP provides scholarships for students from developing countries to pursue master’s degrees in development-related fields at universities around the world, supporting future leaders committed to reducing poverty and improving living standards.
university: Partner universities in the U.S., Europe, Africa, and Japan
fields: Development Studies, Economics, Public Policy, Infrastructure, Environment
tags: Development, Fully Funded, Master’s, World Bank

name: Taiwan ICDF Scholarship
description: The International Higher Education Scholarship Program, central to the TaiwanICDF, offers full scholarships to outstanding students from partner countries to pursue higher education in Taiwan through collaborations with local universities. The goal is to support the socio-economic growth of partner countries through the cultivation of highly talented individuals. This program also enhances the internationalization of Taiwan's universities and expands Taiwanese youth's global perspective.

name: The University of New South Wales (UNSW) - UNSW Scholarships for International Students
description: The University of New South Wales (UNSW) offers a variety of scholarships for international undergraduate and postgraduate coursework students commencing in 2025 and 2026. Some scholarships require a separate application, while others are awarded automatically to eligible students based on their admission application.

name: University of Glasgow - Global Leadership Scholarships
description: The University of Glasgow offers the Global Leadership Scholarship for international students pursuing a postgraduate taught Master's degree, providing £10,000 towards tuition fees for eligible programs starting in September 2026. This scholarship is for academically exceptional students and is applied for through the online Scholarship Portal after receiving a program offer.

name: ASEAN Undergraduate Scholarship - National University of Singapore (NUS)
description: The National University of Singapore (NUS) ASEAN Undergraduate Scholarship is a fully funded scholarship for outstanding students from ASEAN member countries (excluding Singapore) applying for full-time undergraduate programs. No separate application is required; it is awarded based on a student's admission application to NUS. The scholarship covers subsidized tuition fees, a living allowance, and an accommodation allowance, and requires strong academic performance, leadership qualities, and good co-curricular records.

name: Global Undergraduate Exchange Program (US)
description: The Global Undergraduate Exchange Program (also known as the Global UGRAD Program) provides one semester scholarships to outstanding undergraduate students from around the world for non-degree full-time study combined with community service, professional development, and cultural enrichment.

name: Seoul National University - Asia Development Bank-Korea Fellowship Program
description: the ADB-Korea Fellowship Program (KFP)—established through a partnership between the Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Government of the Republic of Korea (represented by the Ministry of Economy and Finance)—provides government officials from ADB’s developing member countries (DMCs) with the opportunity to pursue Master’s degree programs in fields critical to public sector capacity building. ADB-Korea Fellowship Program (KFP) aims to strengthen the institutional capacity of governments in developing countries by equipping officials with advanced knowledge and skills and applying their expertise to drive national development and policy reforms.

name: Jardine Scholarship Undergraduate - Oxford and Cambridge Scheme
description: The Jardine Foundation was founded in 1982 by the Jardine Matheson Group, with the aim to develop outstanding leaders, and improve access to higher education by offering full-ride scholarships. Through empowering individuals with the latest knowledge and skills, the Scholarships enable social mobility, and economic development in the markets the Group operates.The Foundation offers outstanding applicants from Cambodia, mainland China, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand and Vietnam  full-ride scholarships to study at Oxford and Cambridge Universities, and for courses at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.  Aspiring students from Hong Kong and Indonesia are also eligible to apply to the University of Hong Kong, and the Universitas Gadjah Mada for scholarships to study an undergraduate programme.

name: Swedish Institute Scholarship for Global Professionals
fields: Specific fields related to sustainable development and democracy

name: Google PhD Fellowship
description: The Google PhD Fellowship Program recognizes outstanding graduate students pursuing innovative research in computer science and related fields. Fellows receive full tuition coverage, a generous stipend, and mentorship from a Google Research scientist.
fields: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Human-Computer Interaction

name: University of Melbourne - Melbourne International Undergraduate Scholarship
description: The Melbourne International Undergraduate Scholarship is offered to high-achieving students who are enrolling in a bachelor degree and are citizens of countries where international educational opportunities are limited by financial disadvantage.

name: Enic Kazakhstan Scholarship Program
description: The Enic Kazakhstan Scholarship Program is the Kazakhstan Government Scholarship for International Students, administered by the Higher Education Development National Center, or "ENIC-Kazakhstan". It provides funding for international students pursuing Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD degrees at universities in Kazakhstan

name: Singapore International Graduate Award (SINGA)
description: SINGA is a collaboration between the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR), Nanyang Technological University (NTU), National University of Singapore (NUS), Singapore Management University (SMU) and Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD). SINGA aims to train PhD candidates in the fields of Biomedical Sciences, and Physical Science and Engineering. Awarded students can choose to do their research work mainly at A*STAR, NTU, NUS, SMU or SUTD.

name: Google Women Techmakers Scholarship
description: The Google Women Techmakers Scholarship is designed to support women pursuing degrees in computer science, computer engineering, or closely related technical fields. Recipients receive financial support and access to a global community of women in tech.

name: SNU Global Hope Scholarship
description: The SNU Global Hope Scholarship is a financial aid program for international students from developing countries who are studying at Seoul National University (SNU). The scholarship is funded by the Samsung Dream Scholarship Foundation and is available for both undergraduate and graduate students.

name: Hong Kong PhD Fellowship
description: Established by the Research Grants Council (RGC) of Hong Kong in 2009, the Hong Kong PhD Fellowship Scheme (HKPFS) aims at attracting the best and brightest students in the world to pursue their PhD studies in Hong Kong's universities.Applicants should demonstrate outstanding qualities of academic performance, research ability / potential, communication and interpersonal skills, and leadership abilities.

name: Schlumberger Foundation Faculty for the Future Fellowship
description: The Faculty for the Future Fellowship supports women from developing and emerging countries who are pursuing PhD or postdoctoral research in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) disciplines at leading universities worldwide.

name: Samsung Global Sungkyun Scholarship - Sungkyunkwan University (SKKU)
description: The Samsung Global Sungkyun Scholarship is a program for international undergraduate students at Sungkyunkwan University (SKKU). Recipients are selected based on academic merit and are awarded significant financial support, which may include full tuition and a monthly stipend, for up to four academic years.

name: Monash University - RTP Stipend Scholarship (RSS)
description: Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships, funded by the Australian Government, support both domestic and international students undertaking Research Doctorate and Research Masters degrees at Australian universities. As part of this program, a RTP Stipend (living allowance) is available to help support students with living costs whilst studying at a Monash Australia campus.

name: Duke University - Karsh International Scholars Program
description: A fully-funded scholarship for undergraduate international students at Duke University who demonstrate exceptional academic and leadership potential. (Based on document: S-1)

name: Monash University - International Merit Scholarship
description: The Monash International Merit Scholarship is for high-achieving international students undertaking a full-time undergraduate or postgraduate (coursework) degree at a Monash campus in Australia. The scholarship provides $10,000 per year towards tuition fees for the duration of the degree.

name: Stanford University - Knight-Hennessy Scholars
description: Knight-Hennessy Scholars is a multidisciplinary, multicultural graduate scholarship program. Each Knight-Hennessy scholar receives up to three years of financial support to pursue graduate studies at Stanford while engaging in experiences that prepare scholars to be visionary, courageous, and collaborative leaders who address complex challenges facing the world.

name: MEXT University - University of Tokyo, Multidisciplinary Engineering
description: The MEXT (Monbukagakusho) Scholarship at the University of Tokyo for the Multidisciplinary Engineering program is a scholarship that can be obtained through the university recommendation route (U to U), where the university will recommend potential scholarship recipients to MEXT. The program offers Master of Engineering or Doctor of Engineering degrees for international students and covers study and living expenses.

name: Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships - PhD Scholarships for Indonesia
description: A fully-funded scholarship for Indonesian PhD students and researchers to pursue studies or research in Switzerland. (Based on document: S-3)

name: Beasiswa Garuda
description: Garuda Scholarship is a degree scholarship program that aims to provide the widest possible access and opportunities for achievement to as many of the Nation's children as possible, especially those from underrepresented backgrounds.

name: Study in Saudi
description: The "Study in Saudi Arabia" program aims to provide one-stop service facilities for applicants in applying for, and initiating tuition scholarships that are provided by the Ministry of Education and educational institutions through Universities in Saudi Arabia. This aims to make the process of application process becomes easier and more flexible for all applicants.

name: Boston University - Trustee Scholarship
description: The Boston University (BU) Trustee Scholarship is a prestigious, full-tuition merit award for exceptionally accomplished incoming undergraduate students. To apply, students must submit the Common Application and a separate Trustee Scholarship essay, along with other required materials, by a deadline around December 1st. Competitive applicants typically have strong academic records, leadership experience, and a high GPA, with some scholars having a perfect 4.0 GPA. The scholarship covers full tuition and mandatory fees and is renewable for up to four years if certain criteria are met.

name: Graduate Research Scholarships - University of Melbourne
description: The University of Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships (GRS) are prestigious awards for high-achieving domestic and international students pursuing master's by research or doctoral degrees. The primary scholarships offered are the Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarship and the Melbourne Research Scholarship (MRS).

name: The University of Hong Kong (HKU) - HKU Foundation Scholarship for President Scholars
description: The HKU Foundation Scholarship for President's Scholars is an exclusive undergraduate award for top-scoring incoming students with no separate application required. It provides a scholarship package, potentially covering full tuition and offering overseas study opportunities, with higher levels of achievement resulting in more comprehensive benefits. The scholarship also comes with opportunities to represent the university as an ambassador.

name: NIH Oxford-Cambridge Scholars Program
description: The NIH Oxford-Cambridge Scholars Program is an accelerated, individualized doctoral training program for outstanding science students committed to biomedical research careers. It involves collaborative study between the NIH, University of Oxford, and University of Cambridge.
university: NIH, University of Oxford, University of Cambridge
tags: Medicine, Research, Fully Funded, Joint Degree

name: Aga Khan Foundation International Scholarship Program
description: The Aga Khan Foundation provides scholarships for outstanding students from developing countries who have no other means of financing their studies. The scholarship supports postgraduate studies and is based on a 50% grant and 50% loan model.

name: University of British Columbia (UBC) Scholarships
description: The Karsh International Scholars Program at Duke University is a fully funded scholarship for outstanding international undergraduate students. It is a merit-based award that also considers demonstrated financial need.

name: Turkiye Burslari Scholarship
description: Türkiye Scholarships is a government-funded higher education scholarship program runned by the Republic of Türkiye for international students. The primary purpose of Türkiye Scholarships is to provide equal opportunities to successful students around the world in order to receive them

name: ASEAN Undergraduate Scholarship - Nanyang Technological University (NTU) - National Curriculum
description: The ASEAN Undergraduate Scholarship is offered by the Nanyang Technological University (NTU) for citizens or permanent residents from the Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN), except Singapore.

name: Government of Ireland - International Education Scholarships (GOI-IES)
description: Scholarship from the Government of Ireland for Master's or PhD studies, providing a full fee waiver and an allowance of €10,000. (Based on document: S-2, S-3)

name: University of Helsinki Scholarship Programme
description: Scholarships are intended for excellent tuition fee-liable students from outside the EU/EEA and Switzerland who want to complete a Master's programme at the University of Helsinki. University of Helsinki scholarship programme consists of tuition fee waivers, waiving the tuition fee for 50% or 100%. Please note that even if you received a tuition fee waiver from the University's scholarship programme, you still need to cover your living costs from your own funds. Please note that only a very limited number of tuition fee waivers can be awarded and most of them cover 50% of the tuition fee. Tuition fee waivers are awarded to the best students on the grounds of academic overall assessment according to the general master's degree entrance requirements, academic excellence and success in previous studies and motivation to study in a master's programme at the University of Helsinki.

name: AAUW International Fellowship
description: The AAUW International Fellowship is awarded to women pursuing full-time graduate or postgraduate studies in the United States who are not U.S. citizens or permanent residents. The fellowship supports women committed to advancing equity for women and girls through education and research.

name: LPDP Tahap 1
description: Fully-funded scholarship program from the Indonesian government for Master's and Doctoral studies domestically or internationally. (Based on document: S-2, S-3)

name: KAIST International Student Scholarship (Fall Intake)
description: Scholarship for international undergraduate students at KAIST, usually covering full tuition and a living allowance. (Based on document: S-1)

name: DAAD Development-Related Postgraduate Courses (EPOS)
description: The DAAD EPOS scholarships offer funding for graduates from developing countries to pursue postgraduate studies in Germany in development-related fields such as economics, engineering, environmental management, and social sciences.
fields: Sustainable Development, Economics, Engineering, Social Sciences, Environmental Studies

name: MEXT Scholarship
description: Fully-funded scholarship by the Japanese Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology for international students at various levels. (Based on document: D-2, S-1, S-2, S-3)

name: IBM PhD Fellowship Program
description: The IBM PhD Fellowship honors exceptional PhD students who are addressing technical challenges important to IBM and the world. Research areas include AI, quantum computing, cloud, cybersecurity, and data analytics.
fields: Artificial Intelligence, Quantum Computing, Cloud Computing, Data Science, Cybersecurity

name: Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship Program
description: Stipendium Hungaricum, the Hungarian Government’s most prestigious higher education scholarship programme, offers a wide range of courses for high-achieving international students with an excellent academic track record. The scholarship aims to support the internationalisation of Hungarian higher education and its constant development, strengthen the international relations of the academic and research community, and promote the good reputation and competitiveness of Hungarian higher education worldwide. The programme, founded by the Hungarian Government in 2013, is supervised by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and managed by the Tempus Public Foundation. It is based on bilateral education agreements between Hungary and the governments of the sending countries. It is available on five continents in over 90 countries, attracting tens of thousands of international students each year. Applicants are offered around 800 full degree programmes, covering all higher education fields at all degree levels, including part-time and doctoral programmes.

name: NL Scholarships
description: The NL Scholarship is a grant for international students from outside the European Economic Area (EEA) who want to pursue a bachelor's or master's degree in the Netherlands. It is funded by the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science, and by Dutch research universities and universities of applied sciences

name: Korea University - Graduate Scholarship
description: For graduate studies at Korea University, international students can apply for the Global Korea Scholarship (GKS) or the university's own institutional scholarships, including the KU GSIS International Students Scholarship and the SK Global Scholarship

name: The University of Sydney - MBA Director's Scholarship
description: The University of Sydney's MBA Director's Scholarship is a merit-based award for full-time Master of Business Administration (MBA) students, ranging from $10,000 to $40,000. Eligibility requires an unconditional offer of admission into the MBA (Leadership and Enterprise) program, and the scholarship amount is based on a ranking against selection criteria.

name: Mandela Rhodes Scholarship
description: The Mandela Rhodes Scholarship is open to African students showing leadership potential and academic excellence, providing full funding for postgraduate study in South Africa along with leadership development and mentorship opportunities.

name: Beasiswa France Excellence
description: The France Excellence Scholarship is a scholarship program from the French Government through the Institut français d'Indonésie (IFI) that offers funding for Indonesian students to continue their studies at French higher education institutions. The scholarships are divided into several types based on the level of study and priority fields, including Bachelor, Master, Master 2, and Doctorate. There are also thematic scholarships that focus on priority areas of France-Indonesia cooperation such as marine and creative industries, as well as the Kartini Sains Scholarship specifically for master's students in the field of science.
url: Pencarian di situs resmi Campus France

name: MoE Taiwan Scholarship
description: The Ministry of Education (abbreviated below to “MOE”) has formulated the Taiwan Scholarship Program Directions (also known as the “Taiwan Scholarship Program Guidelines”) to encourage outstanding international students (with the exception of students from the Mainland Area, Hong Kong, and Macau) to undertake degree studies in Taiwan to familiarize themselves with the academic environment in Taiwan and promote communication, understanding, and friendship between Taiwan and the international community.

name: University of Groningen - Eric Bleumink Fellowship
description: Fellowship for high-potential Master's students from developing countries to study at the University of Groningen. (Based on document: S-2)

name: DAAD Study Scholarships - Study scholarships for STEM disciplines
description: The aim of the scholarship programme is to support the qualification and employability of young academics and future professionals from developing and emerging countries. It offers the opportunity to continue their academic and professional career in innovation-driving STEM fields in Germany with a Master’s degree in mathematics, computer science, natural sciences and engineering. The scholarship programme is aimed at high-achieving students from developing and emerging countries who would like to complete a Master’s degree in the STEM subjects at a German university. You can apply if you have completed your studies with a first degree recognised in Germany (e.g. Bachelor's degree) by the application deadline at the latest. If you already have a Master’s degree by the application deadline, you cannot apply. Funding is available for a complete Master's degree (full-time, on-campus) at a state or state-recognised university in Germany in the STEM subjects of mathematics, computer science, natural sciences and engineering. Study programmes with integrated stays outside Germany are excluded. Interdisciplinary degree programmes must have a designated STEM focus.

name: Gates Cambridge Scholarship
description: The Gates Cambridge Scholarship is awarded to outstanding applicants from outside the United Kingdom to pursue a full-time postgraduate degree in any subject at the University of Cambridge. It aims to build a global network of future leaders committed to improving the lives of others.
